intro: Vincetoxicum abyssinicum, commonly known as Abyssinian moonseed, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish fruits that contain toxic seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas at higher elevations. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for ornamental purposes.
